intro: Spermacoce ovalifolia, commonly known as the ovalleaf spurred gooseberry, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. Its fruits are small, fleshy berries that turn red when mature, often containing several seeds. Spermacoce ovalifolia is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along stream banks.
